title: Sources: Kelly officially fired by LSU without cause
content: The posturing over Brian Kelly's $54 million buyout from LSU is over, sources told ESPN, as the school sent him a letter Wednesday saying it is officially terminating him without cause.

title: Sources: Jays, Cease reach 7-year, $210M deal
content: Right-hander Dylan Cease, who has made at least 32 starts in each of the past five seasons, reached a seven-year, $210 million deal with the Blue Jays, sources told ESPN.

title: Center Ragnow ends retirement to return to Lions
content: Frank Ragnow, a four-time Pro Bowler for the Lions, is ending his five-month retirement and returning to play for Detroit.

title: Faulk expected to land Southern job, sources say
content: Former NFL star and current Colorado RBs coach Marshall Faulk is expected to become head coach at Southern University, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Celts halt Pistons' win streak at 13 in frantic finish
content: Cade Cunningham scored 42 points but missed a potential game-tying free throw in the closing seconds as the Pistons fell to the Celtics 117-114, ending their 13-game winning streak.

title: Moehrig's suspension upheld; safety out vs. Rams
content: Panthers safety Tre'von Moehrig's one-game suspension for striking 49ers wide receiver Jauan Jennings in the groin area has been upheld on appeal, the league announced Wednesday night.

title: Source: Angels in talks to buy out Rendon deal
content: The Angels and Anthony Rendon are in talks about buying out the final year of his seven-year, $245M contract, a source told ESPN. The third baseman is expected to retire.

title: QB Smith apologizes for obscene gesture to fans
content: Geno Smith apologized for making an obscene gesture toward fans as he walked off the field following a 24-10 loss to the Browns on Sunday. It's the second time he has made such a gesture toward fans since joining Las Vegas.

title: How a legendary historian is quietly fueling OKC's championship rise
content: As OKC GM Sam Presti formed a Thunder team built for a dynasty, he was inspired by a man who has been working on the same project for more than 50 years.

title: Men's Feast Week guide: Breaking down Kansas' win, Michigan-Gonzaga preview
content: From the Players Era in Las Vegas to a showcase in New York City, here's what we're watching Thanksgiving week.

title: Women's Feast Week guide: Texas, South Carolina to meet for Players Era title
content: Texas, which beat No. 3 UCLA, and South Carolina meet Thursday in a game that will determine the No. 2 team in the country.

title: What we’re hearing entering Week 13: State of the Bucs, George Pickens’ future, fantasy intel
content: Are the Buccaneers worried about their losing streak? Will the Cowboys extend George Pickens? Here's the latest intel, plus fantasy football advice.

title: How a Dak Prescott initiative saved a Cowboys exec with Stage 2 cancer
content: Dallas QB Dak Prescott and the senior VP of communications look back on their friendship through a fortified bond: "It's bigger than football."

title: MLB offseason survey: 16 execs predict free agency, blockbuster trades and more
content: We surveyed the sport on the biggest free agents and top trade candidates as baseball's hot stove heats up.

title: Fantastic finishes from the biggest games of Rivalry Week
content: The most memorable endings from Ohio State-Michigan, Alabama-Auburn, Clemson-South Carolina and more.

title: Week 14 preview: Rivalry Week stakes, plus conference championship scenarios
content: Ahead of Rivalry Week, our college football experts get into the stakes in the biggest matchups of Week 14.

title: The search for one of the ugliest rivalry trophies in college sports: King Spud
content: Is King Spud lost forever? The trophy's vanishing act is one of the stranger mysteries in college sports.

title: WWE Survivor Series preview: Can the WarGames teams coexist?
content: Greg Wyshynski breaks down the biggest storylines at Survivor Series: WarGames, including John Cena's final PLE match.

title: The Thanksgiving Panic Index: Which NHL teams are the most concerned?
content: Teams in playoff position on the holiday tend to stay there (77.1% since 2005). Who is in the best and worst shape?

title: UCL talking points: Pep's tinkering costs City, Arsenal look unstoppable
content: Statement wins, coaches under pressure and some very bizarre team selections. ESPN's writers break down the best -- and worst -- from Matchday 5 in the UCL.

title: Are Arsenal the best in Europe? Bayern win boosts Champions League contender tag
content: A convincing 3-1 win over Bayern Munich has only strengthened Arsenal's case as firm favorites to win.

title: Matchup rankings: Upgrade Mark Andrews, downgrade Javonte Williams
content: The most and least favorable matchups in the NFL for this week's games at the four key fantasy positions: QB, RB, WR and TE.

title: Over the river and through the parlays: Thanksgiving is a sports betting holiday too
content: With big games and marquee teams on the menu, Thanksgiving week is among busiest of the year for sportsbooks.

title: 'Victory Royale': 2017 Xbox One copy of Fortnite sells for $42,500
content: The sealed Xbox One copy of Fortnite received an overall grade of 10 A++, the highest grade possible.

title: Is it time for McLaren to prioritize Norris over Piastri?
content: McLaren has refused to favor one driver over the other all season, but as Max Verstappen closes in, should the Papaya outfit issue team orders?

title: WNBA CBA negotiations: Why players say league's latest proposal is 'slap in the face'
content: The Nov. 30 WNBA deadline is looming for a new CBA. The two sides continue to meet during the holiday week.

title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, plus Thanksgiving game memories
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 13. We also picked out Thanksgiving memories for 31 teams that have played on the holiday (sorry, Jaguars).

title: Solak: Should Browns stick with Sanders? Could Colts lose AFC South?
content: Sizing up Shedeur Sanders' first start, the three-team race in AFC South, George Pickens' next contract, more.

title: Pound-for-pound rankings: Haney in, Canelo out, Benavidez moves up
content: Where do Devin Haney, David Benavidez and Jesse Rodriguez land after dominant victories? Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: Fantasy fast break: Eric Moody on Mikal Bridges' durability, Kel'el Ware's rise and more
content: Eric Moody's fantasy basketball insights you need to know about, including Mikal Bridges' durability and production in New York, Kel'el Ware's second-year rise and more.

title: Offseason questions for every NWSL team: A way-too-early look at 2026
content: The NWSL season is over, and the planning for 2026 begins immediately. Here is one burning question for each team.

title: How San Diego went from expansion afterthought to cup contender
content: Little was expected of San Diego in its debut year, but this risk-taking young side is one step from MLS Cup.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal eye move for Elche's Mendoza
content: Could Rodrigo Mendoza's next move be in the Premier League? Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: 11 Railway Workers Die In Train Accident During Equipment Testing In China
content: A train hit railway workers in southwest China on Thursday, killing 11, local railway authorities said after the crash in Yunnan province.

title: Pardoned By Trump, Binance Founder Now Accused Of Funding Hamas, Hezbollah
content: The lawsuit accuses Zhao and his close associate, Guangying "Heina" Chen, of purposely creating Binance to help criminals and terrorists facilitate money laundering on a global scale.

title: The Hong Kong Deadly High-Rise Fire: All You Need To Know
content: A devastating fire tore through a Hong Kong high-rise residential complex, killing dozens of people with hundreds still missing.

title: Sensex And Nifty Hit All-Time High: Why Markets Are Rising
content: Investor sentiment was supported by expectations of potential rate cuts by both the US Federal Reserve and the Reserve Bank of India.

title: Madhya Pradesh IAS Officer Gets Notice Over Remark On Brahmin Daughters
content: The Madhya Pradesh government has issued a show-cause notice to the AJAKS State President, Senior IAS officer  Santosh Verma, over his controversial statement involving Brahmin daughters, terming it a serious breach of service conduct.

title: Afghan Man Who Shot 2 National Guard Members Entered US In 2021
content: A 29-year-old Afghan national has been identified as the suspected gunman who shot two West Virginia National Guard members deployed to Washington DC, just blocks from the White House, in a brazen act of violence.

title: Big US Move After Afghan Man Shoots 2 National Guard Members
content: The United States has stopped the processing of all immigration requests of Afghan nationals after two National Guard personnel were shot near the White House in Washington DC.

title: Explained: Why Trump Deployed National Guard In The US Capital
content: The shooting of two members of the National Guard in the US capital has shined a spotlight on President Donald Trump's controversial decision to station more than 2,000 troops in the city.

title: Gaming Platform WinZO's Founders Arrested By Enforcement Directorate
content: The Enforcement Directorate has arrested online money gaming platform WinZO founders - Saumya Singh Rathore and Paavan Nanda - on money laundering charges, officials said Thursday.

title: "No Work-Life Balance Any More": The Everyday Struggles In Bengaluru
content: In India's tech capital Bengaluru, the morning "rush hour" lasts so long it devours half the workday, throttling productivity in a city often viewed as the poster child of a booming economy.

title: 'Keeping Promise A Big Power Move': DK Shivakumar's Reminder To Congress
content: In a cryptic remark amid the Karnataka chief ministership tussle, state Congress president and incumbent Siddaramaiah's challenger, DK Shivakumar, has said word power is world power, and keeping a promise is a big power move.

title: Where Trump's Legal Battles Stand After His Return To The White House
content: Since Trump's reelection last year, four separate criminal cases - including his hush money conviction and federal allegations of election interference and illegally hoarding classified documents - have either been dropped, resolved or put aside.

title: Guinea Bissau Military Suspends Media Outlets, Electoral Process In Latest Coup
content: Soldiers in Guinea-Bissau appeared on state television Wednesday saying they have seized power in the country, following reports of gunshots near the presidential palace, three days after national elections.

title: "Twisted My Arm. I Screamed. He Stopped": Delhi Woman Assaulted By Uber Rider
content: An Uber ride to a doctor's clinic turned horrendous for a Delhi woman after the driver allegedly physically assaulted her. The woman, Bharati Chaturvedi, called the Uber safety and the Delhi Police but allegedly did not receive any help from either.

title: No Chairs, No Books: Children In Gaza Return To Makeshift Classrooms
content: With no backpack, books or uniform, 11-year-old Layan Haji navigates the ruins of Gaza City and heads to a makeshift classroom after two years of war halted her education.

title: "A Home, Gone In Flames": Residents Recount Horror Of Hong Kong Tower Fire
content: Residents anxiously awaited news of their loved ones Thursday at a temporary shelter as one of Hong Kong's deadliest fires in decades engulfed a 2,000-unit high-rise complex.

title: 44 Dead After Fire Ravages 7 High-Rise Buildings In Hong Kong, 3 Arrested
content: Firefighters were still dousing a devastating fire Thursday which ripped through a Hong Kong high-rise complex, killing at least 44 people and leaving hundreds missing according to authorities.

title: Expansion Work To Begin At Temple In Andhra Capital, Foundation Ceremony Today
content: The Lord Venkateswara Swamy Temple in Amravati, the capital of Andhra Pradesh, will soon get a new Rajagopuram, Mandapams, and Annadanam Complex.

title: "Suspect From Hellhole Afghanistan": Trump On "Act Of Terror" In US Capital
content: US President Donald Trump has called the National Guard shooting in Washington DC an act of terror and a crime against humanity.

title: Hong Kong fire: 44 dead, hundreds still missing; videos show flames leaping from high-rise towers
content: Hong Kong is reeling after a devastating fire engulfed a high-rise housing estate, claiming at least 44 lives and leaving hundreds missing. The blaze, the city's worst in decades, rapidly spread through the Wang Fuk Court complex, fueled by flammable bamboo scaffolding used during ongoing repairs. Authorities have arrested three men in connection with the incident.

title: WH shooting: Video shows US cops pinning Afghan shooter to ground in a chaotic aftermath
content: Chaos erupted at the White House after an Afghan national, identified as Rahmanullah Lakanwal, allegedly shot and injured two National Security Guards. Arriving in the US in 2021 under Operation Allies Welcome, the suspect's background is under verification.

title: Stock market hits all-time high! Nifty goes above 26,300; Sensex crosses 86,000 for the first time
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied in trade on Thursday with both indices hitting lifetime highs. While Nifty50 went above 26,300, BSE Sensex crossed the 86,000 mark for the first time.

title: ‘Take me in your lap, pain is unbearable’: Haryana basketball player's final words to father
content: Two promising young basketball players, Hardik Rathi and Aman Kumar, tragically lost their lives when rusted poles collapsed on them during practice in Rohtak. Hardik, 16, had dreams of playing for India, while 15-year-old Aman had vowed to make his mother proud. Their untimely deaths have left a profound void, cutting short bright futures and shattering families' hopes.

title: WTC: Can India still reach the final? Tough road ahead after shock home whitewash
content: India's 2027 World Test Championship final aspirations have suffered a significant blow following a 2-0 home series defeat to South Africa. Now fifth in the WTC standings, Shubman Gill's team must achieve near-perfect results in their remaining nine Tests to have a realistic chance at qualifying for the championship decider.

title: AI race pressure: Sundar Pichai to Google teams; ‘Hopefully we get some rest’
content: Following the successful launch of its advanced AI model, Gemini 3.0, Google CEO Sundar Pichai acknowledged his engineers are overdue for a break. The AI's impressive capabilities have boosted Google's market value, with the company's stock surging significantly. Pichai attributed this success to years of foundational work and a full-stack approach to AI innovation.

title: Cheteshwar Pujara’s brother-in-law Jeet Pabari found dead at home
content: Businessman Jeet Pabari, brother-in-law of cricketer Cheteshwar Pujara, allegedly died by suicide at his Rajkot residence. Suffering from depression for two months, Pabari was found hanging by his wife. This incident occurred exactly one year after a rape complaint was filed against him by his former fiancée.

title: 'Ugly, inside out': Trump’s personal attack on another female journalist
content: Donald Trump attacked New York Times reporter Katie Rogers, calling her "ugly, both inside and out," after the newspaper published a story questioning his energy levels. The article cited signs of tiredness and recent health checks, which the Times defended as based on first-hand information. Trump's remarks follow a pattern of targeting female journalists with personal insults.

title: 'Worst experience': Siraj slams Air India after being stranded for hours
content: Cricketer Mohammed Siraj expressed frustration with Air India Express after a significant flight delay from Guwahati to Hyderabad. He criticized the airline for a lack of communication and prolonged waiting, calling it a "worst airline experience." Air India Express later apologized, citing unforeseen operational reasons for the cancellation and assuring passenger assistance.

title: AI spending race: Mark Cuban warns Perplexity, OpenAI, Google; only one will win
content: Mark Cuban has cautioned major AI firms like OpenAI and Google against excessive spending in the race for the most powerful models. He likens the current AI arms race to the 1990s search engine boom, predicting a potential bubble and winner-take-all outcome. Cuban believes true disruption will emerge from unexpected breakthroughs, not just incremental improvements.

title: Jet rides for girlfriend to Shein deals: Top 5 controversies of FBI director Kash Patel
content: Kash Patel's time as FBI chief during the Trump administration stirred considerable debate. Among the claims were allegations of misusing government aircraft for personal jaunts to visit his girlfriend, controversial decisions regarding the handling of Jeffrey Epstein's case, and the dismissal of senior FBI personnel.

title: Chennai fraud row: Investors crash wedding reception, thrash bridegroom
content: A bridegroom was assaulted at his wedding reception by investors claiming he defrauded them of crores through fake stock market schemes. Despite multiple complaints, police had not registered a case until the incident. Victims alleged he collected large sums, promising high returns, but lost their money and pressured them for more.

title: 'Word power is world power': DK Sivakumar's cryptic post stirs Karnataka CM churn
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar's cryptic social media post, "Word power is world power," fueled speculation about a potential leadership change. The remarks followed a late-night meeting with cabinet colleague Satish Jarkiholi, reportedly to discuss an alleged unwritten pact for a chief minister transition. The Congress high command confirmed consultations to resolve the ongoing power tussle.

title: Google chips threaten Nvidia: Stock drops $250B; claims 'we lead industry'
content: Nvidia's dominance in AI chips faced a significant challenge as Meta reportedly considers billions in spending on Google's competing AI processors. This news sent Nvidia's stock plummeting, while Alphabet's shares climbed. Google's TPUs are emerging as a credible alternative, potentially disrupting Nvidia's market hold.

title: 'All immigration requests …': US takes major step after Afghan national named shooter
content: Following a shooting incident near the White House involving an Afghan national, the US has indefinitely halted all immigration requests from Afghan citizens. The suspect, who arrived in 2021 under a resettlement program, critically injured two National Guard members. This decision prompts renewed scrutiny of vetting processes for Afghan arrivals.

title: Ashes: First Test ends in two days — ICC still rates Perth pitch ‘very good’
content: The ICC has rated the Perth Ashes Test pitch 'very good' despite its rapid two-day finish, sparking debate on modern batting and pitch expectations.  While England and Australia collapsed spectacularly, the surface was deemed fair.  This follows scrutiny of India's recent spin-friendly Kolkata Test, highlighting contrasting views on challenging playing conditions.

title: IND vs SA: 'No knee-jerk reactions' — Saikia says BCCI sticking to long-term plan
content: BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia acknowledged the need for soul-searching regarding Indian batters' struggles against spin at home. He emphasized that players must adapt to various wicket conditions, advocating for a five-day wicket as ideal for Test cricket. Saikia also highlighted the team's transition phase after key players' departures.

title: 45 bidders battled: Fierce auction for HR88B-8888 car registration number; record bid of over Rs 1.1cr
content: A fancy registration number, HR 88B 8888, has fetched a record-breaking bid of Rs 1.17 crore in Haryana, surpassing all previous VIP number auctions nationwide. The number, from the Badhra subdivision, attracted 45 bidders after a reserve price of Rs 50,000. The highest bidder, reportedly a Hisar resident named Sudhir, has a set time to complete the payment.

title: 5 biomarkers to predict diseases years before symptoms appear
content: A vascular surgeon successfully treated a young patient at risk of leg amputation due to PAD with a structured intermittent walking program. This exercise regimen, involving brisk walking intervals followed by rest, promoted collateral artery growth, significantly reducing pain and restoring mobility, ultimately avoiding amputation.

title: Ayesha Curry shares heartfelt note for Stephen days after marriage controversy
content: Ayesha Curry posted a heartwarming message for her husband Stephen Curry's new book, "Shot Ready," amidst recent online backlash. She had previously expressed on a podcast that she didn't initially want marriage or children, leading to fan outrage and accusations of disrespecting her husband.

title: Industrialist’s bahu found dead in south Delhi: Diary mentions ‘love and trust’
content: A 38-year-old housewife, daughter-in-law of an industrialist, allegedly died by suicide at her Vasant Vihar home. Police are investigating the circumstances, having seized a diary detailing her relationship with her husband. While no suicide note was found, her brother alleged marital discord and infidelity, claims denied by the husband's lawyer.

title: Candace Owens pulls show off air after alleging Macron tried to harm her
content: Candace Owens has halted her show, alleging French President Macron plotted her assassination, a claim she reported to the White House and US counterterrorism teams. She also implicated the Macrons in Charlie Kirk's death. These accusations surface amidst a defamation lawsuit filed by the Macrons against Owens for her claims about Brigitte Macron's gender identity.

title: Meerut blue drum murder: Accused Muskan Rastogi gives birth in custody
content: An undertrial, Muskan Rastogi, accused of murdering her husband and hiding his body, gave birth to a baby girl named Radha in Meerut jail. The infant will remain with her mother in jail until the age of six, while the deceased husband's family has requested a DNA test.

title: Charlie McAvoy faces heartbreaking week as wife Kiley shares emotional update
content: Boston Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy is going through a devastating week. As his wife Kiley McAvoy revealed an emotional family update on social media. With Charlie already recovering from recent jaw surgery. The couple is now facing additional personal challenges involving their young son.

title: WH shooting 'act of terror': Trump says suspect from 'hellhole' Afghanistan came in 2021
content: Two National Guard soldiers were shot near the White House. President Donald Trump condemned the attack as an act of terror. He urged a reinvestigation of Afghan refugees admitted under the Biden administration. The suspect, from Afghanistan, entered the country in 2021. Officials described the shooting as a bold and targeted attack. Both service members were hospitalized in critical condition.

title: IND vs SA: India's home fortress falls! Ex-cricketer says 'aura has disappeared'
content: South Africa's dominant 2-0 Test series victory over India has sparked concerns about the team's Test cricket form. Former player Dinesh Karthik highlighted a concerning decline, citing bowlers being outplayed, batting struggles, and inconsistent selection. He questioned the frequent changes at the crucial No. 3 position, emphasizing the need for stability to regain past glory.

title: 'Nice headshot': Fans react as LaMelo accidentally hits Jalen Brunson in the face
content: A viral clip of LaMelo Ball accidentally hitting Jalen Brunson in the face with a basketball during a Knicks-Hornets game has sparked amusement online. While many fans found the incident humorous, with some joking about a "headshot," others speculated it might have been intentional. Brunson, despite the mishap, led the Knicks in scoring.

title: 'I called 100 multiple times': Delhi based environmentalist claims physical assault
content: An environmentalist reported being physically assaulted by an Uber driver in Delhi after a dispute over navigation. The driver allegedly became agitated, drove erratically, and then violently twisted her arm when she asked him to stop.  Despite attempts to contact police and Uber, she faced delays in receiving assistance. Uber has since removed the driver from its platform.

title: Brazilian volleyball star Julia Azevedo survives back gunshot in Rio attack
content: Brazilian volleyball player Julia Rocha Marques de Azevedo, 28, survived a shooting attempt in Rio de Janeiro after being shot in the back. The bullet narrowly missed her spine and bladder, with doctors stating she was lucky to be alive. Azevedo, who feels 'born again,' is recovering at home and aims to return to volleyball within a month.

title: Shooting near White House: Afghan national named suspect in security breach
content: An Afghan national, identified as Rahmanullah Lakanwal, is accused of critically injuring two National Guard members near the White House. The suspect, who entered the U.S. in 2021, allegedly fired a handgun at the soldiers during a patrol. The FBI is investigating the incident as a possible act of terrorism.

title: When Dharmendra spoke about his battle with alcohol and being a heavy drinker, had revealed he was sober for eight years
content: Veteran actor Dharmendra reflected on his decision to quit alcohol eight years prior to a 2007 interview, describing it as a transformative choice. He confessed that heavy drinking had negatively impacted his stamina and thinking, wishing he had never touched it. Sobriety, he found, brought a deeper, more genuine happiness and a stronger sense of self.

title: Top 10 richest people in 2025: Which billionaires are leading global wealth?
content: Global wealth in 2025 remains dominated by tech and retail titans. Elon Musk leads with $342 billion, followed by Mark Zuckerberg and Jeff Bezos. The Forbes list highlights 3,028 billionaires, with the US, China, and India at the forefront. Visionary leaders in innovation and global markets continue to amass extraordinary fortunes.

title: Abhinav Bindra pays tribute to teen athlete who died in freak training accident
content: The footage shows Hardik taking a run-up, reaching for the basket and appearing to attempt a dunk. As he briefly hung from the rim, the entire iron structure gave way, crashing down and striking him in the chest.

title: Twin basketball tragedies rock Haryana: 2 teens die after rusted poles collapse
content: Two teenage basketball players, Hardik Rathi and Aman, tragically died in separate incidents in Haryana after basketball hoop poles collapsed on them. These horrific accidents have exposed serious flaws in the state's sports infrastructure and governance, leading to the suspension of a district sports officer and calls for urgent reforms.

title: ‘Stranger Things 5’: From Eggos to Demogorgon popcorn bucket, fans go all out
content: Fans are eagerly anticipating the release of 'Stranger Things Season 5 Volume 1' today, November 27, 2025. The sci-fi drama's final chapter has generated significant buzz, with enthusiasts preparing themed snacks and watch parties. The season will unfold in three parts, with subsequent volumes releasing on December 25 and December 31, 2025.

title: Two national guard soldiers shot near White House; Trump reacts
content: Two National Guard soldiers were critically wounded in a shooting near the White House. President Trump issued a statement condemning the "animal" responsible and vowing a steep price, while also praising the military. The suspect is in custody, and authorities are responding to the scene.

title: McGregor and Khabib trade fresh barbs 7 years after their last UFC fight
content: Khabib Nurmagomedov has hit back at Conor McGregor's accusations of a digital project scam tied to Dagestani culture. McGregor claimed Nurmagomedov used his father's legacy to sell digital papakhas, but Nurmagomedov refuted the claims, calling McGregor a liar and defending the project as a way to share Dagestani traditions globally. The rivalry continues off-screen.

title: SteveWillDoIt slams Mike Majlak as ‘biggest loser’ after heated Logan Paul clash
content: YouTuber SteveWillDoIt clashed with Mike Majlak on Logan Paul's podcast. The interview turned sour, leading Steve to walk off. He later posted on Instagram calling Majlak a 'loser'. The incident gained significant social media attention. Logan Paul expressed surprise at Steve's behavior. Majlak and Paul have not yet responded to Steve's posts.

title: Supreme Court sets up medical board at Noida hospital to explore passive euthanasia for 31-year-old
content: This is the second time in as many years that parents of the patient have approached the top court seeking passive euthanasia for their son

title: Assam Cabinet approves report on ST status for six communities
content: The report was submitted by a three-member Group of Ministers headed by Education Minister Ranoj Pegu

title: Family of late Kerala dalit activist Chitralekha faces eviction after bank issues foreclosure notice
content: Kannur Co-operative Urban Bank, controlled by Congress-led management committee, has ordered the family to vacate the house by December 7, warning that it will be seized on December 18 if the dues remain unpaid

title: Govt appoints new FRROs for Rajasthan, Assam, Chandigarh and Haryana
content: The appointment of the Foreigners Regional Registration Officers have been made under the new Immigration and Foreigners Act, 2025

title: Manipur: 3 militants arrested for 'threatening' to bomb Sangai tourism festival
content: The action came following a video posted on Facebook by a user on November 21, which contained threats to bomb the festival being held from November 21 to November 30

title: David Beckham’s visit in Visakhapatnam school highlights classroom innovation
content: The initiative is a part of a wider programme of the Mantra4Change supported by Education Above All aimed at improving classrooms across Andhra Pradesh, Bihar, Odisha and Nagaland

title: Amaravati to have ‘Cosmos Planetarium’ under MoU with Indian Institute of Astrophysics
content: Officials said the upcoming planetarium will provide immense benefits to students by offering clear visual understanding of astronomy-related subjects including the universe, planets, stars and galaxies

title: ED arrests gaming platform WinZO's founder duo on money laundering charges
content: The ED had accused WinZO of "engaging in criminal activities and unscrupulous practices as customers were made to play with algorithms without being made aware of the fact that they are playing with the software and not with humans in real-money games."

title: Kerala local body polls: Parties scout among ASHAs, Haritha Karma Sena members for candidates
content: The connect of these grassroots workers with people and familiarity of the locality make them ideal choices for parties when it comes to selecting candidates

title: Kerala local body elections: High Court verdict may reflect on Munambam poll result
content: Within hours of the High Court allowing their long-standing demand for restoration of revenue rights for their holdings, six Munambam residents remitted property tax, with the remaining one set to follow suit. All three fronts have claimed credit for the development which came on the 410th day of the residents’ protest

title: Kerala local body elections: In Thiruvananthapuram Corporation polls, no party is in the driving seat
content: The LDF, in keeping with its recent trend, has fielded a number of fresh faces, seeking to continue in power, while the UDF has announced its candidates much ahead of others, hoping for a revival from its below-par performance last time. The BJP has fielded a good number of the sitting councillors compared to the two fronts, aiming to extend its good run

title: Tesla flags low maintenance and fuel costs to woo Indian buyers
content: In India, Tesla competes with homegrown rivals like Mahindra & Mahindra and Tata Motors and global players like SAIC Motor’s India unit and Vietnamese EV maker VinFast Auto

title: Supreme Court hearing on SIR LIVE: SC Bench asks ECI to file its response to pleas challenging SIR in Tamil Nadu by December 1
content: The CJI-led Bench commenced on November 26 the final hearing on a larger issue on legality and validity of the ECI's decision to undertake the revision of electoral rolls.

title: Bombay HC issues notice to Maharashtra govt over Chandrapur PAPs long wait for jobs and benefits
content: 85 displaced families accuse State and Maharashtra State Power Generation Company Ltd. of ignoring statutory quota and rehabilitation norms

title: Senate poll protest: Panjab University students to ‘gherao’ BJP offices on December 3
content: The protest was initially launched against the Centre's decision to restructure Panjab University's governing bodies -- the senate and the syndicate.

title: Maharashtra CM promises 10 lakh employment opportunities for locals at Vadhavan Port
content: Speaking at an election rally, the CM Fadnavis assures locals top priority in 10 lakh jobs at Vadhavan Port, pledging rapid growth and keeping environmental balance

title: T.N. braces for intense rainfall; Bay weather system may deepen
content: Expectations run high that the wet spell could help wipe out rain deficits in districts such as Perambalur, Chengalpattu, Chennai, and Kancheepuram.

title: Building capacity for data storage top priority of MeitY: Secretary
content: Speaking at Dr. (Mrs.) YGP’s Centenary Celebrations, Mr. Krishnan said India generated 20% of the world’s data, but had the capacity to store merely 4%.

title: Punjab farmers demand fulfillment of long pending demands
content: Farmers associated with over 30 farmer and farm labour unions under the banner of Samyukt Kisan Morcha  submitted a memorandum of their demands to local authorities, addressed to the President of India

title: Rajasthan all set for storage systems in solar energy
content: Deputy Chief Minister Prem Chand Bairwa will felicitate the top 100 achievers of India’s solar sector on the second and final day of the exhibition on  November 27

title: Protest held in Jammu’s Ramban for MBBS quota for Hindus in varsity
content: J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah said merit and not religion should be the basis of admission in varsities

title: Amid Bengal SIR, Kolkata’s Sonagachi sex workers fear loss of rights
content: Three welfare organisations from one of Asia’s largest red light areas have written to the Chief Electoral Officer of West Bengal seeking special considerations and assistance during SIR for the sex worker community

title: Afghan Minister Azizi’s visit was very successful and productive: MEA
content: During the visit, Afghan’s Minister Azizi met External Affairs Minister Jaishankar and discussed bilateral ties, connectivity and people to people exchanges

title: It’s IUML vs others in Ponmundam panchayat
content: IUML is fielding candidates for 16 of the 18 seats under its official ‘ladder’ symbol, while the Congress and the CPI(M) are contesting only through Independent candidates

title: Police seize 400 litres of illegal liquor in Bihar’s Saran, arrest 47 people
content: “The state police’s focus would be on maintaining the rule of law established by Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, says Deputy CM Samrat Choudhary

title: Karnataka RTC unions meet CM, seek release of arrears and pay revision
content: Following the meeting, Anantha Subba Rao, president of the KSRTC Staff and Workers’ Federation, said the discussion with the Chief Minister lasted nearly an hour and was “positive and constructive”.

title: Madras High Court commends T.N. govt for implementing its orders to prevent women harassment at workplaces
content: Justice R.N. Manjula says, it is the need of the hour for the Centre too to take similar proactive steps

title: Karnataka HC orders official of Central govt. to inspect jaggery factory that was closed allegedly due to influence of State Minister who owns sugar factory
content: The High Court of Karnataka, noting allegations that a private jaggery factory’s closure was influenced by a current Cabinet Minister who is also a director in a private sugary factory, restrained officials of the State government in interfering in the affairs of the jaggery factory till further orders.

title: Assam tea planters’ body sets conditions to part with land for labourers
content: The Consultative Committee of Planters’ Associations seeks relief from providing welfare facilities and adequate compensation for land to be acquired once the Assam Fixation of Ceiling on Land Holdings (Amendment) Bill, 2025, is enacted

title: Most Kochi city campuses untouched by election fever
content: While the local body elections have not caused any ripples on campuses, a few students are clear about their own politics

title: Saving Himalayas is as important as saving borders, says veteran BJP leader Murli Manohar Joshi
content: He was criticising the Char Dham all-weather road project and the reckless construction of roads in the hills; Defence Ministry has previously said double-laned roads are needed to meet border security concerns in the hills

title: Studying Bangladesh’s plea for Sheikh Hasina’s extradition: India
content: “We remain committed to the best interests of people of Bangladesh, including peace, democracy and stability in that country,” Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said

title: ED facilitates restitution of assets to applicant
content: The Supreme Court restored a deposit to Lodha Developers Ltd. under the provisions of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, an official of the agency said

title: Arbitrary actions by China ‘most unhelpful’ to ties: MEA
content: The spokesman emphasised that Arunachal Pradesh is an ‘integral and inalienable part of India and this is a fact that is self evident’

title: Maharashtra to push for renaming IIT Bombay to IIT Mumbai, says CM Fadnavis
content: The development comes amid row over Minister Jitendra Singh’s recent remarks; MNS’s Raj Thackeray warns of a bid to erase Marathi identity

title: Cabinet approves Phase 2 of Pune Metro Rail project
content: Under this phase, Line 4 (Kharadi–Hadapsar–Swargate–Khadakwasla) and Line 4A (Nal Stop–Warje–Manik Baug) would be completed

title: Canara Bank to raise ₹3,500 crore through ATI Bonds to strengthen its capital base
content: Sunil Kumar Chugh has been appointed as bank’s new Executive Director with effect from November 24, 2025, for a period of 3 years

title: Ram Temple flag raising: India rejects Pakistan’s ‘remarks with contempt’
content: Ministry of External Affairs counters Pakistan’s “deep concern” over Ayodhya Ram Temple flag, cites record of bigotry and human rights violations

title: Right to trade of online gaming platforms can’t be at the cost of human lives, government tells Supreme Court
content: Affidavit says money sourced through these activities is laundered or used as funding for terror, besides being a reason for increasing addiction and fatalities among young users

title: Supreme Court committee recommends phased creation of Goa Tiger Reserve
content: Panel proposes that 468.6 sq. km. area, which contains 102 households, be notified as core and buffer areas of the reserve in the first phase; another 208 sq. km. with 612 households, may be considered later

title: Supreme Court asks whether a ‘foreigner’ can be allowed to use Aadhaar to gain entry into poll roll
content: Justice Joymalya Bagchi observes that the inherent jurisdiction of ECI to “examine, vet, verify” documents submitted to it is traceable to Section 21 of Representation of the People Act and Article 326, which requires a voter to be a citizen

title: Mumbai marks 26/11 anniversary as leaders reiterate zero tolerance for terror
content: Tributes paid to victims and security personnel; President, PM and Home Minister call for united fight against terrorism

title: CJI calls for national judicial policy to reduce divergence
content: The CJI said a uniform judicial policy would encourage coherence across jurisdictions and bring more clarity and consistency in the decisions of the various constitutional courts on seminal questions of law

title: Four killed as speeding truck hits road roller in Gujarat
content: Contract workers and an engineer died on the Udaipur–Ahmedabad highway after a truck rammed into repair machinery; driver booked for negligent and rash driving

title: HC orders Calicut University to convene Senate meeting in 30 days
content: A Bench of Justice V.G. Arun issued the directive on a petition filed by the State government, challenging notifications issued by the Governor, in his capacity as Chancellor, on the appointment of a new V-C for the varsity

title: Mamata urges BLOs not to take any extreme steps
content: Bengal CM’s appeal comes after two booth level officers in West Bengal died by suicide during the ongoing SIR process

title: Prosecute officials who grant illegal building plan permissions in hill stations, orders Madras High Court
content: A Division Bench of Justices S.M. Subramaniam and Mohammed Shaffiq reverses an order passed by a single judge, who had permitted construction of a building within 17 metres from reserve forests

title: Leadership row in Karnataka will be settled with talks in Delhi: Congress chief Kharge
content: D.K. Shivakumar appeared to be offering olive branch to leaders aligned with Siddaramaiah, meeting many including Satish Jarkiholi

title: BJP promises blueprint for development of local bodies in Kerala
content: A report card will be presented to the people every year to outline development works already undertaken and those in the pipeline, says Rajeev Chandrasekhar

title: No clinical establishment must deny life-saving aid to patients needing emergency care, says Kerala HC
content: Hospital authorities ought to also ensure that, along with the discharge summary, all investigation reports pertaining to the treatment too have to be handed over to enable patient to maintain proper records, says Division Bench of the High Court

title: Property tax revision drive marred by claims of  extortion by GHMC staff
content: Confusion over notices, lack of awareness among some residents about their rights have made them vulnerable even as official data shows sharp rise in revised tax assessments across thousands of properties

title: Tamil Nadu’s deceased donor count reaches 240
content: Official data show a total of 1,128 deceased donors were recorded in the country in 2024, of which 80% came from five States - Tamil Nadu (268), Telangana (188), Maharashtra (172), Karnataka (162) and Gujarat (119)

title: UDF hopes to continue its winning streak as LDF sees a silver lining in Palarivattom
content: LDF says Congress rebel Joseph Alex’s entry as an Independent will work in its favour, while the UDF maintains that his presence will barely affect its vote bank in the division; BJP promises Centrally-administered projects and solution to drug menace

title: ‘Rewarding separatists, torturing patriots’ has stopped in J&K: Manoj Sinha
content: ‘J&K is now moving ahead, guided by the ideals of equity, social, and economic justice as enshrined in the Constitution by Babasaheb Ambedkar,’ the J&K Lieutenant Governor said at a Constitution Day event

title: Delhi HC seeks Centre’s response on U.K. academic Nitasha Kaul’s plea against entry ban
content: Ms. Kaul, who has written about Kashmir, Hindutva and nationalism, was deported while trying to enter India in February 2024, and had her OCI status revoked for “anti-India activities” in May 2025

title: CPI(M) stages protest in Amaravati, seeks Parliament law on capital status
content: The party presses the Centre to commit funds for Amaravati, take responsibility for institutional borrowings and address bank lending issues, warning of intensified protests if there is no response

title: Betting lines for every top-25 team in college football
content: the Ohio State Buckeyes and Michigan Wolverines face off as AP top-15 opponents . a week left in the regular season, Dinich joins this Morning to break down the playoff chances . it will be the 36th time that the AP could reshape the CFP bracket .

title: Week 14 Anger Index: Why BYU, Notre Dame and others should be mad
content: Ohio State stays atop the latest CFP rankings, with Indiana, Texas A&M, Georgia and Texas Tech all remaining in their same spots in the top five . a botched extra point at the end of Notre Dame-Texas a&M still hinges on the college football playoff rankings . the canes had a 90% chance of winning, according to ESPN's metrics .

title: NBA Power Rankings: Raptors, Pistons battle for top of East standings
content: we're about one month into the 2025-26 NBA regular season and coming to the end of group play for the third-annual NBA Cup this week . the Detroit Pistons continue to be dominant through the first couple of weeks of play, climbing to the top of the Eastern Conference and 2.5 games ahead of the Toronto Raptors . our insiders break down this week's NBA power rankings .

title: Bottom 10: The Lane Train seems to have gone off track
content: Paul Finebaum explains why it feels like Lane Kiffin will be picking a new job instead of staying at Ole miss . Rusty: "you think we need one more." "Ocean's Eleven" reminds you of Thanksgiving dinner and the laughs shared around the table .

title: MLB offseason grades: AL champs land an ace as Blue Jays sign Cease
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if you're a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, we'll weigh in with what it all means for next season and beyond .

title: CFP Bubble Watch after Tuesday's ranking: Who needs a win during Rivalry Week?
content: the ACC's hope of having two teams qualify for the 12-team field is still alive . five ACC teams are still ranked above no. 24 Tulane, the only representative from a group of 5 conference . a gap remains in spite of the head-to-head win .

content: the 2025-26 season has reached its quarter mark, with all 32 teams having played more than 20 games . a first-quarter letter grade for all 32 clubs is through the games of Nov. 23 . they lead the NHL in goals per game while also giving up the fewest goals .

title: Let's balance rights and duties, PM urges citizens on Constitution Day
content: PM Modi urged citizens to never miss out on their constitutional right to vote . he cited stalwarts, including Mahatma Gandhi, to underscore the primacy of duties for social and economic progress . in a letter to citizens on constitution day, he suggested people organise special events on November 26 to mark the coming-of-age of youngsters in schools and colleges .

title: Issue instructions to deport illegals from Bengal, BJP tells EC

title: 2 crore Aadhaar numbers of deceased deactivated in national clean-up
content: the unique identification authority of India has deactivated over two crore Aadhaar numbers . it is part of a nationwide clean-up drive to strengthen the accuracy and reliability of the database . officials say the exercise is aimed at preventing identity fraud and ensuring that govt benefits linked to . the deactivation process draws on data sourced from the Registrar General of India (RGI)

title: Despite 33% quota, women's representation in governance still low: President Murmu
